snippet: Diplomats from 17 nations, fearing further chaos and the expansion of terrorist groups in the country, also called for an immediate cease-fire.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry attends special meeting in Rome on Libya crisis, joining voices of other diplomats who are urging Libyan leaders to put aside their differences and form unity government; global community is concerned about weak Libyan government and tribal infighting allowing unchecked growth of Islamic State and Al Qaeda extremist groups.
lead_paragraph: Diplomats from 17 nations, fearing further chaos and the expansion of terrorist groups in the country, also called for an immediate cease-fire.

headline.main: Libyan Factions Urged to Form Unity Government
headline.print_headline: Libya Rivals Are Urged to Govern Together

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
